item.title: Parliament session LIVE: Both houses adjourned till 2pm amid row over Amit Shah's remarks - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament session LIVE: Both houses adjourned till 2pm amid row over Amit Shah's remarks

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Parliament session has been adjourned amid a dispute over Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar. The Congress party has demanded an apology for what they argue are disrespectful remarks.

  • Both the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha have been adjourned till 2pm during the ongoing Winter Session of Parliament.
  • The Congress party criticized Amit Shah's remarks made during a parliamentary debate and called for his resignation.
  • Several bills are being considered, including those related to the representation of Scheduled Tribes in Goa and the regulation of oilfields.
“He has insulted Baba Saheb Ambedkar and the Constitution.” - Mallikarjun Kharge, Congress MP

The disruption in the Parliament highlights tensions between the ruling party and the opposition following controversial statements regarding a key figure in Indian history, BR Ambedkar.

item.title: Chaos in Gaur City 2: Woman slaps 6-year-old after dispute between 2 kids, faces FIR - The Times of India
item.description:
Chaos in Gaur City 2: Woman Slaps 6-Year-Old After Dispute Between Kids

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

In a shocking incident in Gaur City 2, a woman has been accused of slapping a 6-year-old child following a dispute between two kids. This altercation has prompted authorities to file a First Information Report (FIR) against the woman involved.

  • The incident took place after a disagreement escalated between children playing in the area.
  • Witnesses report that the woman acted irrationally, leading to the confrontation.
  • The FIR filed marks a significant response from local authorities regarding child safety and community conduct.
“Such behavior is unacceptable, and we will not tolerate any harm done to children in our community.” - Local Authority

This event highlights the importance of resolving conflicts amicably and the need for protective measures for children in local communities.

item.title: J&K: Former DSP among 6 killed after fire breaks out at house in Kathua - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tragic Fire in Kathua Claims Six Lives Including Former DSP

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A significant fire incident occurred in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua district, leading to the tragic deaths of six individuals, including a former deputy superintendent of police and his young grandson. The fire broke out in the early hours, with locals discovering it around 2:30 AM.

  • The deceased include Avtar Krishen Raina, 81, former DSP, and his 3-year-old grandson.
  • Four others were injured and are receiving treatment at the Government Medical College in Kathua.
  • Preliminary investigations indicate that victims died from smoke inhalation.
  • Union Minister Jitendra Singh expressed his condolences on social media.
  • The police have initiated an investigation into the incident.
“Deeply shocked to learn about the accidental death of 6 members of a family resulting from fire incident in the Shiv Nagar area of Kathua city.” - Jitendra Singh

This unfortunate incident has highlighted serious concerns regarding fire safety and the urgent need for better awareness in residential areas.

item.title: 'Satellite beams turned off over India': Elon Musk rejects claim Starlink being used in Manipur - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Satellite beams turned off over India: Elon Musk rejects claim Starlink being used in Manipur

Published: 18 December 2024, Source: Deccan Herald

In response to accusations of Starlink satellite technology being used in the conflict-ridden state of Manipur, Elon Musk clarified that no Starlink beams are operational over India.

  • Security forces seized internet devices along with arms during a raid in Keirao Khunou.
  • Photos of seized items included a device with the Starlink logo, leading to speculation about its use.
  • Musk stated on Twitter, "This is false. Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India."
  • The seized items included a satellite antenna, router, and cables.
  • Investigation underway to determine how these devices reached Manipur.
  • Starlink does not have a license to operate in India.
  • Manipur has experienced ethnic violence resulting in over 250 deaths since May 2023.
This is false. Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India.

Elon Musk's response highlights the ongoing concerns regarding the use of technology in conflict areas and raises questions about the accessibility of satellite services in regions experiencing strife.

item.title: NSA Ajit Doval meets China FM Wang Yi; Beijing says 'ready to work with India' - The Times of India
item.description:
NSA Ajit Doval meets China FM Wang Yi; Beijing says 'ready to work with India'

Date: [Publication Date Here] Source: [Source Name Here]

This article discusses the recent meeting between India's National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, where both parties expressed readiness to strengthen bilateral relations.

  • Ajit Doval and Wang Yi held discussions on various strategic issues between India and China.
  • Beijing emphasized its willingness to collaborate and improve ties with India.
  • The meeting comes in the backdrop of ongoing border disputes and regional security concerns.
“We are ready to work with India on mutual interests,” said Wang Yi during the meeting.

This meeting signifies an important step towards enhancing cooperation between India and China amidst ongoing challenges.

item.title: Starlink in Manipur violence: Elon Musk rejects claim, says satellite beams turned off over India - The Hindu
item.description:
Elon Musk Denies Starlink Usage in Manipur Violence

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Elon Musk, the founder of SpaceX, responded to claims that Starlink devices were used in the recent violence in Manipur, stating that satellite beams were switched off over the region.

  • Security forces seized Starlink devices during a raid in Imphal East district, raising concerns of their usage by insurgents.
  • The Seized items included a Starlink satellite antenna and a router.
  • Musk clarified on social media that there is no Starlink service active in India.
  • Reports indicate significant ethnic violence in Manipur, resulting in over 250 deaths and thousands displaced since May of last year.
“This is false. Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India.” - Elon Musk

This incident highlights the ongoing investigation into the presence of Starlink devices in a region experiencing severe conflict.

item.title: Residents raze own homes near newly found temple in UP's Sambhal amid crackdown by authorities: Reports - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Residents Demolish Own Homes Near Newly Found Temple in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh

Date: Dec 18, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Residents of Sambhal have begun demolishing their own homes near a newly discovered temple, fearing the administration's actions will leave them with nothing.

  • Muslim residents were reported to demolish homes built on alleged temple property to salvage valuables.
  • The district administration has set up CCTV cameras and initiated an anti-encroachment drive.
  • Following a violent incident during a court-mandated archaeological survey, the ongoing anti-encroachment operations have faced resistance.
  • The Supreme Court has paused legal actions against the mosque until further hearings.
  • The recently unearthed Shri Kartik Mahadev Temple had been closed since 1978 and housed several idols.
“At least we can salvage some of our precious things this way. If we leave the demolition to the administration, we might not be left with anything.”

The situation continues to develop as residents express their concerns about potential loss and the consequences of ongoing investigations.

item.title: 'Ready To Work With India': China Ahead Of Crucial Meeting With Ajit Doval - News18
item.description:
China Ready to Collaborate with India as Doval-Wang Meeting Begins

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: News18

China has expressed its readiness to work with India to enhance bilateral relations ahead of a crucial meeting between National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Beijing.

  • The talks aim to restore relations following the October 21 agreement to disengage troops in eastern Ladakh.
  • This meeting marks the first high-level talks between India and China since December 2019.
  • Focus areas include the India-China boundary question and strengthening mutual trust through dialogue.
  • China is committed to respect India's core interests and bring relations back to stable development.
“China is ready to work with India to implement the important common understandings between the leaders of China and India.” - Lin Jian, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson

This meeting underscores the ongoing diplomatic efforts to normalize ties after years of tensions, particularly following the Galwan Valley clash in 2020.

item.title: High Courts cannot direct trial courts to write bail order in particular manner: Supreme Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
High Courts cannot direct trial courts to write bail order in particular manner: Supreme Court

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

The Supreme Court ruled that constitutional courts cannot dictate the format of bail orders, affirming that trial courts have the discretion to determine how to write such orders.

  • The Court was reviewing an appeal from a District and Sessions Judge regarding adverse remarks made by the Rajasthan High Court on a bail order.
  • The High Court had criticized the judge for failing to present details in a specific format, suggesting potential indiscipline.
  • The Supreme Court clarified that directions from the High Court were merely suggestions, not mandatory requirements for trial courts.
  • It concluded that High Courts should not jeopardize the careers of judicial officers through adverse remarks.
“The adverse remarks and observations made against the appellant in the aforesaid orders cannot be the basis for taking any action against the appellant on the administrative side,” the Supreme Court clarified.

This ruling emphasizes the independence of trial courts in managing their procedures regarding bail applications.

item.title: Cold wave in Delhi to worsen this winter? City shivers, IMD predicts mercury may drop to... | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Cold Wave in Delhi: IMD Predicts Worsening Conditions This Winter

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Live Mint

Delhi is experiencing a notable cold wave, with the India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecasting further drops in temperature, potentially worsening the conditions this winter.

  • The IMD recorded a temperature of 8 degrees Celsius in Delhi at 2.30 AM on Tuesday.
  • A cold wave warning has been issued across various northern states in India, including Jammu and Kashmir, Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh.
  • Delhi's air quality has deteriorated significantly, registering a severe Air Quality Index (AQI) reading of 481.
  • The school system in Delhi-NCR has shifted to a hybrid mode due to the reintroduction of anti-pollution measures under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP).
“Delhi’s air quality plummeted to alarming levels despite strict measures.”

The cold wave and poor air quality have raised concerns among residents and authorities, highlighting the urgent need for effective measures to address these challenges.

item.title: Priyanka Gandhi on Yogi Adityanath's jibe at her Palestine bag: ‘Throwing youths into…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Yogi Adityanath's Comments on Her Palestine Bag

Publication Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has reacted to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's remarks regarding her bag featuring the term 'Palestine'. She criticized the state's policy of sending youths to Israel for work in conflict zones, calling it shameful.

  • Priyanka Gandhi carried a 'Palestine' bag to Parliament, which attracted criticism from BJP leaders.
  • Yogi Adityanath stated that over 5,600 youths from UP have gone to Israel for employment, emphasizing their safety and salaries.
  • Priyanka labeled sending youths into a war zone for jobs as a disgrace and highlighted the unemployment issues in UP.
  • She spoke out against the exploitation of these youths and their families, who live in constant fear.
"Throwing our youths into the war zone for employment is not something to pat on the back but a matter of shame." - Priyanka Gandhi

This exchange underscores ongoing tensions between political leaders regarding employment strategies and international relations.

item.title: 'Ready to work with India': China ahead of key meet between Ajit Doval and Wang Yi - The Times of India
item.description:
NSA Ajit Doval meets China FM Wang Yi; Beijing says 'ready to work with India'

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

In a significant diplomatic meeting, Indian National Security Advisor Ajit Doval engaged with China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi, where both parties expressed a willingness to collaborate and work together, indicating a thaw in relations.

  • Ajit Doval and Wang Yi met to discuss enhancing bilateral ties between India and China.
  • Beijing has shown a readiness to cooperate with India on various fronts.
  • The discussions signify a move towards stabilizing relations post recent tensions.
"Both nations are ready to build a robust partnership for mutual interests."

This meeting is seen as a crucial step in addressing longstanding issues and paving the way for future collaborations between the two countries.

item.title: Delhi AQI: Air quality at ‘severe-plus’ category in some areas amid GRAP curbs - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi AQI: Air quality at ‘severe-plus’ category in some areas amid GRAP curbs

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi faced dangerously high levels of air pollution with the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) reaching over 440, classifying the air quality as ‘severe’. The city implemented Stage 4 restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) to combat the pollution crisis.

  • Overall AQI recorded at 442 at 7 am on December 18, 2024.
  • Some monitoring stations reported AQI levels in the ‘severe-plus’ category beyond 450.
  • AQI levels at worst stations: Nehru Nagar (480), Alipur (471), Anand Vihar (481).
  • Stage 4 restrictions include a ban on construction activities and non-essential vehicle entry into Delhi.
  • Experts attribute rising pollution to low wind speeds and various local factors.
“Breathing Delhi's polluted air is equivalent to smoking approximately 10 cigarettes a day.”

The ongoing air quality crisis necessitates urgent action and compliance with GRAP restrictions to protect public health.

item.title: ‘Ready to work with India’, says China ahead of key Doval-Wang talks | What's on agenda - Hindustan Times
item.description:
China Ready to Collaborate with India Before Key Doval-Wang Talks

Date: Dec 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

China is prepared to work with India to restore bilateral relations ahead of upcoming talks between India's National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, marking the first meeting of Special Representatives in five years.

  • First Doval-Wang meeting since December 2019 will take place in Beijing.
  • China's foreign ministry emphasizes readiness to strengthen mutual trust and settle differences.
  • The two leaders will discuss border management and explore solutions to the boundary dispute.
  • Recent agreements were reached regarding patrolling arrangements along the Line of Actual Control.
  • The military standoff, starting in May 2020, has strained India-China relations.
“China is ready to work with India to implement the important common understandings between our leaders... and bring bilateral relations back to the track of stable and healthy development as soon as possible.”

This structured dialogue represents a critical step in rebuilding relationships strained by previous military clashes and ongoing tensions along the Indo-China border.

item.title: Gurugram Weather and AQI Today: Check weather forecast for December 18, 2024 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gurugram Weather and AQI Forecast for December 18, 2024

Published Date: December 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Today's weather in Gurugram features a temperature of 17.44 °C, with a maximum of 22.52 °C and a minimum of 8.02 °C. The air quality index (AQI) is rated at 500, falling in the hazardous category.

  • The temperature today in Gurugram is forecasted to be 17.44 °C.
  • The day's humidity is at 35% with wind speeds reaching 35 km/h.
  • Tomorrow's forecast predicts temperatures between 13.24 °C and 22.76 °C.
  • The AQI is at 500, which is hazardous; caution is advised.
  • Weather for the next week shows mostly clear skies.
“The usage of masks and air purifying devices is highly advised.”

It's essential for residents to stay informed about weather conditions and air quality to plan their activities accordingly.

item.title: Congress accuses Amit Shah of insulting Ambedkar in Parliament speech, demands apology - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Demands Apology from Amit Shah for Comments on Ambedkar

Date: Dec 18, 2024
Source: HT News Desk

The Congress party criticized Amit Shah for his comments regarding BR Ambedkar during a Rajya Sabha address, demanding an apology from the Home Minister.

  • Amit Shah accused Congress of using Ambedkar's name as a political tool.
  • Shah stated that citing Ambedkar had become a 'fashion' for Congress.
  • Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, condemned Shah's remarks.
  • Kharge emphasized that Ambedkar is revered as a messiah for marginalized communities.
  • Jairam Ramesh labeled Shah's comments as disgusting and reflective of BJP's deep-seated animosity towards Ambedkar.
“For crores of people like me, Babasaheb Ambedkar is no less than God.” - Mallikarjun Kharge

In light of Shah's comments, the Congress party continues to assert the importance of Ambedkar's legacy and the need for respect towards it.
